thread.title: If You've Been Wanting a Pepsi-Branded Smartphone, It's Apparently on the Way
thread.title_full: If You've Been Wanting a Pepsi-Branded Smartphone, It's Apparently on the Way

author: Christopher Heine
title: If You've Been Wanting a Pepsi-Branded Smartphone, It's Apparently on the Way
text:
If You've Been Wanting a Pepsi-Branded Smartphone, It's Apparently on the Way Reportedly will debut next week in China By Christopher Heine October 12, 2015, 12:31 PM EDT Technology Pepsi is getting into phones. Photo Illustration: Dianna McDougall; Source: Getty Images PepsiCo China has been developing a branded smartphone that uses the Android operating system and will debut on Oct. 20 in Beijing, according to MobiPicker . The mobile-focused news site said the device will be called the Pepsi P1, which will have a 5.5-inch display screen and cost around $205. Purchase, N.Y.-based PepsiCo didn't immediately respond to requests for information. But it appears to be completely uncharted territory for a packaged-goods brand to get into the mobile-phone space. And it will be fascinating to watch whether the P1s become popular in China and intriguing to see if Coca-Cola follows suit with a phone of its own. In the carbonated soft drinks category, Coke had a market share of 63 percent in 2014, while PepsiCo's share was around 30 percent, per Chinadaily . Get the Technology Today newsletter:
